BIBLIOGRAPHY
“Education’s Concern in Copyright Law Revision** - speech by Harold Wigren,
Television Consultant, NEA; May 20, 19 54-
“Effect of S.3 008 on Educational Broadcasting” - paper prepared by
Michael E. Hobbs, Legal Assistant, WGBR-TV, Boston .
“Statement by Ad Hoc Committee on Copyright Law” - before Panel of Consultants
to Register of Copyrights; New York, N.Y., August 16, 1964, by
Harry Rosenfield, counsel for NEA.
“Statement of Position on Behalf of National Association of Educational Broad¬
casters” - by James Gammon, NAEB counsel.
Press Release of Ad Roc Committee on Copyright Revision - prepared by
Fred S. Siebert, Dean of the College of Communication Arts, Michigan
State University, August 5, 1964.
